entities: United Nations Integrated Peacebuilding Office in Sierra Leone
Security Council Committee established pursuant to paragraph 10 of resolution 1132 (1997) concerning Sierra Leone
summary: The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on Sierra Leone, decides to terminate, with immediate effect, the measures set forth in paragraphs 2, 4, and 5 of resolution 1171 (1998), and to dissolve the Committee established by paragraph 10 of resolution 1132 (1997) with immediate effect. The Council commends the role of the UN Integrated Peacebuilding Office in Sierra Leone and welcomes the update from the Permanent Representative of Sierra Leone, requesting that the measures be lifted. It also urges states to cooperate with the Special Court for Sierra Leone and INTERPOL to bring Johnny Paul Koroma to justice if he is found to be alive. The Council reaffirms its commitment to support Sierra Leone's recovery, peace, security, and development.
